title: Kristen Stewart says Jodie Foster had doubts for her Hollywood career in 2002 film Panic Room
text:
Kristen Stewart is best known for playing Bella Swan in Twilight's teenage vampire series from 2008 to 2012.

But the American actress, 29, said years earlier her Panic Room co-star Jodie Foster expressed doubts of her career progression in Hollywood.

Kirsten told Australian magazine Stellar on Sunday: 'I remember her thinking there wasn't a chance I'd continue being an actor.'

'She thought there wasn't a chance I'd continue being an actor': Kristen Stewart says Jodie Foster had doubts for her Hollywood career when they starred in 2002 film Panic Room

Panic Room, a thriller about a mother-daughter duo hiding from intruders inside their New York brownstone's panic room, was released in 2002 when Kristen was 12.

Working closely with Jodie, Kristen said the Silence Of The Lambs star thought acting wasn't something she would enjoy as she grew up and became older.

'[Jodie] was like 'you're probably going to direct movies or go back to school'.'

'You're probably going to direct movies or go back to school': Working closely with Jodie, Kristen said the Silence Of The Lambs star thought acting wasn't something she would enjoy as she grew up and became older (Pictured: Panic Room, 2002)

'I understand why she would have thought that about me as a kid. I love her': Kristen only had positive things to say about Jodie in the chat with the Australian magazine

Kristen, who's mother is Australian, added: 'I really love my job, but I understand why she would have thought that about me as a kid. I love her[Jodie].'

In fact, Kristen's career as an actress only grew since co-starring alongside Jodie in the 2002 film.

Towards the end of her appearance in the Twilight saga films, Kristen was named the highest-paid actress in the world in 2010 and 2012.

Hollywood success! Towards the end of Kristen's appearance in the Twilight saga films, the actress was named the highest-paid actress in the world in 2010 and 2012

Taking to directing in recent years, Kristen's first full-length feature 'The Chronology Of Water' is now in post production.

Kristen is still acting too, with her latest role in the reboot of Charlie's Angles with Naomi Scott, and Ella Balinska.

Charlie's Angles will be released in Australian cinemas from November 14
